column1: This is a hormone produced by the adrenal glands and sex glands.
Most of the time blood is drawn from a vein located on the inside of the elbow or the back of the hand.
It is often done on infants who are born with outer genitals that do not clearly look like those of a boy or a girl.

A doctor may recommend this test for women or girls who have male traits such as: - Excess hair growth in places where adult men grow hair - Deep voice or an increase in muscle mass - Absence of menses
